vehicles

Class Vehicle

  • java.lang.Object
    • vehicles.Vehicle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Car, Helicopter

    public abstract class Vehicle
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the base for all types of vehicles to be simulated.
    Version:
    Oct 26, 2025
    Author:
    Nick Stoyanov

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vehicle()
      No argument constructor for vehicle.
      Vehicle(double speed, double maxCapableSpeed, int acceleration, int weight, int racePositionPercentage)
      Defines and creates a vehicle with a base maxSpeed, base acceleration and weight.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vehicle

        public Vehicle(double speed,
               double maxCapableSpeed,
               int acceleration,
               int weight,
               int racePositionPercentage)
        Defines and creates a vehicle with a base maxSpeed, base acceleration and weight.
        Parameters:
        speed - Current Vehicle Speed
        maxCapableSpeed - Maximum Possible Vehicle Speed
        acceleration - Vehicle Acceleration
        weight - Vehicle Weight
        racePositionPercentage - Percentage of race completed

      • Vehicle

        public Vehicle()
        No argument constructor for vehicle.

    • Method Detail

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Accessor method to access the general speed of a vehicle object.
        Returns:
        vehicle speed

      • getMaxCapableSpeed

        public double getMaxCapableSpeed()
        Accessor method to get the maximum possible speed of a vehicle object.
        Returns:
        max vehicle speed

      • getRacePositionPercentage

        public int getRacePositionPercentage()
        Accessor method to access the percentage of the race completed by a vehicle object.
        Returns:
        current position in race as a percentage

      • getAcceleration

        public int getAcceleration()
        Accessor method to access acceleration speed of a vehicle object.
        Returns:
        vehicle acceleration

      • getVehicleWeight

        public int getVehicleWeight()
        Accessor method to get the weight of a vehicle object.
        Returns:
        vehicle weight

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double newSpeed)
        Mutator method to validate and set the vehicle speed (assumed in kmh). The new vehicle speed can not be a negative value, and must be within the confines of the maximum vehicle speed. There are no error messages due to how this method may be used frequently during calculations, and the potential for negative numbers from those calculations.
        Parameters:
        newSpeed - Vehicle Speed

      • setMaxCapableSpeed

        public void setMaxCapableSpeed(double newMaxCapableSpeed)
        Mutator method to validate and set the maximum speed of a vehicle object (assumed in kmh). The maximum speed always be the same or more than the current vehicle speed.
        Parameters:
        newMaxCapableSpeed - Max Vehicle Speed

      • setRacePositionPercentage

        public void setRacePositionPercentage(int newRacePositionPercentage)
        Mutator method to validate and set newRacePositionPercentage of a vehicle object. The variable describes a position in a race, proportionate to the distance of a track.
        Parameters:
        newRacePositionPercentage - Race Position Percentage as an integer

      • setAcceleration

        public void setAcceleration(int newAcceleration)
        Mutator method to validate and set the acceleration of a vehicle object (assumed in kmh). Vehicles can not accelerate faster than they can physically travel.
        Parameters:
        newAcceleration - Vehicle Acceleration

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(int newWeight)
        Mutator method to validate and set the weight of a vehicle object (assumed in lbs).
        Parameters:
        newWeight - Vehicle Weight

      • slowDownByPercentage

        public void slowDownByPercentage(int percentage)
        Method to simulate slowing down a vehicle by a certain percentage.
        Parameters:
        percentage - percentage to slow down by

      • calcSpeed

        public abstract double calcSpeed(double speed,
                                 int weight,
                                 int acceleration)
        Method to calculate a hypothetical vehicle while still considering the weight of the vehicle. Due to how objects can be either land or air, subclasses should use their own formulas for accurately calculating a speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - Vehicle Speed
        weight - Vehicle Weight
        acceleration - Vehicle Acceleration
        Returns:
        calculcated speed

      • weatherDebuff

        public abstract void weatherDebuff()
        In the event of bad weather, this method simulates the effect on the vehicle's performance. The default implementation does nothing as different vehicle types may have different reactions to bad weather.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method to print a summary of the vehicle statistics.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        various vehicle statistics including race position and speed.
